image.altText: A roadside sign reading "Peppimenarti" riddled with holes, on the side of a red dirt road.

items.synopsis: Michael Singar was arrested in 2022 after he confessed to fatally shooting a man with an arrow during a riot in the remote community of Peppimenarti. But after spending 109 days in jail, he was found not guilty.

title.children: Michael spent 109 days in jail for a crime he didn't commit. Lawyers say it's not an isolated case

image.altText: The eye and head of a crocodile swimming in water

items.synopsis: Although rangers complete comprehensive surveys before opening popular Northern Territory swimming holes, they don't guarantee they'll be crocodile-free. Sonar technology and artificial intelligence could help stop attacks.

title.children: Is a spotlight at night really the best way to detect crocs? Sonar and AI could be the future

image.altText: A car park at an outback resort with a red cliff in background.

items.synopsis: A resort west of Alice Springs will close while owners negotiate a water pipeline to be built from a bore 18 kilometres away.

title.children: Water costs render outback resort unviable in peak tourist season

image.altText: Putin KGB zelenskyy composite

items.synopsis: This week's NATO summit in Lithuania highlights how NATO's membership is heavily sought-after in a troubled world.

title.children: How the NATO summit showed off Zelenskyy's power and the lingering fear of 'cruel' KGB ideals

image.altText: A 3D model of the building that burnt down in Surry Hills

items.synopsis: The century-old former hat factory caught fire on a Thursday afternoon. Within seven minutes of the first triple-0 call, the entire building, in the most densely populated part of Sydney, was an inferno.

title.children: Unravelling the inferno that reduced this century-old former hat factory to rubble

image.altText: Images of round metallic objects known as spherules

items.synopsis: Scientists from Harvard University have collected fragments believed to belong to a huge interstellar meteor, saying it could have come from an alien spacecraft.

title.children: Meteor that slammed into PNG may be alien spacecraft, Harvard scientist says

image.altText: BBC newsreader Huw Edwards speaks in suit.

items.synopsis: The BBC presenter facing allegations he paid a young person thousands of pounds for sexually explicit photos is Huw Edwards, the BBC reports, citing a statement from his wife.

title.children: Huw Edwards named as BBC presenter at centre of scandal, police clear him of criminal offence

image.altText: a young man with short hair sits on a couch while patting his black and white, mixed-breed dog

items.synopsis: Keith Kerinauia, 19, is charged with the murder of Declan Laverty while the 20-year-old was working at a Darwin bottle shop in March.

title.children: Man accused of Declan Laverty's murder committed to Supreme Court trial

image.altText: outside of a courthouse in the sun

items.synopsis: An Indigenous mother who spent 10 years in indefinite detention will walk free after the Northern Territory government lost a Supreme Court appeal to have her remain in custody, arguing she is a "serious risk" to the public.

title.children: Darwin mother released from indefinite detention after government loses appeal

image.altText: chairs, a mattress and bedding on a concrete slab

items.synopsis: Lawyers in a Northern Territory town are having to search for clients fleeing DV in makeshift homeless camps due to a critical shortage of safe housing.

title.children: Sexual assaults increase by nearly 95pc, victims sleep rough as crisis accommodation runs out in Katherine

image.altText: Christopher Eubanks raises his fist and grits his teeth at Wimbledon.

items.synopsis: Christopher Eubanks' dream run may have ended but he has a slice of Wimbledon history it took 30 years to conquer, while Aryna Sabalenka showed her power game is going to be extremely difficult to overcome.

title.children: American rewrites Wimbledon record books in defeat

image.altText: Josh Addo-Carry kicks

items.synopsis: A stunning solo try from the Fox, one just as good by the Hammer, and a return to form for some Blues favourites. Here's your five quick hits from State of Origin Game III.

title.children: Five quick hits — the Hammer and the Fox exchange super tries and Tedesco shows his class

image.altText: Two middle-aged men, one in a tight, olive green shirt and the other in a suit, shake hands in front of a woooden wall.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese announces the commitment following a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at the NATO summit in Vilnius.

title.children: 'Best in the world': Australia donates 30 more Bushmaster armoured personnel carriers to Ukraine

image.altText: A designed image showing John Zeitoune, Jye West and a building bearing an ACU logo.

items.synopsis: The Australian Catholic University has launched an internal inquiry after the ABC discovered the founder of the company providing its on-campus security has been charged with corruption — and had a secret business relationship with an employee overseeing its security contract.

title.children: Australian Catholic University accused of ignoring concerns about security contractor

image.altText: A composite image of Carmy from The Bear, Shiv from Succession and Janine from Abbott Elementary.

items.synopsis: Australia's Sarah Snook is one of multiple Succession cast members to be nominated for an Emmy, with The Last of Us, Ted Lasso and Abbott Elementary taking up the other top noms.

title.children: Sarah Snook earns Emmy nomination as Succession dominates

image.altText: Man in black shirt speaking with canon in the background

items.synopsis: The Federal Court had ordered the ABC to hand over documents that included the identity of a US Marine source, but the broadcaster refused to comply.

title.children: ABC drops defence in Heston Russell's defamation case to avoid revealing source

image.altText: Gender dysphoria

items.synopsis: One of Australia's leading medical insurers dumps cover for private practising doctors who initiate hormone treatment in adolescents with gender dysphoria, a decision that may put even more pressure on public hospital waiting lists.

title.children: Medical insurer drops cover for doctors who conduct hormone treatments in adolescents with gender dysphoria

image.altText: Andrew and Nicola stand side by side on the Perth foreshore

items.synopsis: One of Australia's richest couples announce their separation but insist there will be no impact on their shared ventures, including mining giant Fortescue Metals Group.

title.children: Mining billionaires Andrew and Nicola Forrest announce break-up, insist 'no impact' on FMG operations

image.altText: Carol Sandland in a green shirt, looking straight at the camera out the front of a building.

items.synopsis: A nurse who was fired for sharing confidential patient information with the union says she did so because management at the mental health facility was not doing anything about staff safety concerns.

title.children: 'I thought it was legal': Sacked Canberra nurse defends leaking patient information

image.altText: A female AI news reader in a headscarf in a studio.

items.synopsis: Several countries across Asia are now welcoming AI news readers to their screens to present daily bulletins. Could Australia be willing to let digital bots pose as presenters?

title.children: AI news readers are becoming more common across Asia. Will Australia follow suit?

image.altText: An aerial view of houses in Hobart, Tasmania.

items.synopsis: Homebuyers are reporting an unregulated "buyer beware" market has led them to purchase homes with serious defects, even after pre-purchase building inspections. So what are the rules and what recourse do buyers have?

title.children: 'Luck of the draw' for potential buyers doing due diligence

image.altText: Man standing at kitchen bench

items.synopsis: Patrick Quintal purchased a home in the Vicinity complex in Canterbury two years ago. Last week he found out it had "potential serious defects".

title.children: Patrick is one of hundreds fearing huge repair bills after the collapse of major development firm Toplace

image.altText: Will Turner sits on a couch holding a coffee cup.

items.synopsis: New data from the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission shows millions of consumers are paying more on power bills than they should.

title.children: Will's energy bill is going up by 80 per cent. His provider expects to double its profits

image.altText: An aerial shot of a Murrumba Downs neighbourhood shows emergency crews on scene and smoke billowing from a home

items.synopsis: QFES said nine crews were initially sent to the scene, with up to 35 firefighters fighting the blaze.

title.children: 'Almighty bang': Two-storey unit burns down in under an hour north of Brisbane

image.altText: Leslie Van Houten in prison blues wearing glasses in a courtroom

items.synopsis: In 1969, Charles Manson dispatched a group of disaffected young followers on a two-night killing rampage that terrorised Los Angeles. The killings remain etched in the American consciousness.

title.children: A Manson 'family' killer has been paroled but for many Americans those killings won't be forgotten

image.altText: Two people stand in front of a microphone, with blue sky behind them.

items.synopsis: Wakka Wakka man Dennis James Fisher had argued Indigenous people should be able to access the age pension at 64 instead of 67 due to the gap in average life expectancy compared with other Australians.

title.children: Aboriginal elder 'frustrated with white system' after court rejects his bid to access age pension three years early

image.altText: A young boy in school uniform sitting in a schoolyard, surrounded by other kids whose faces are not visible.

items.synopsis: Graham Anthony Hanson was attempting to pull into a rest stop on the wrong side of the road when his car ploughed into the car of a family travelling home from Townsville. Stirling Edwards-Bland died at the scene.

title.children: Jail for driver who downed half a case of beer before killing 12yo twin heading home from swimming carnival

image.altText: A woman throws snow in Thredbo

items.synopsis: Sydney's winter is off to its driest start in 85 years, which is great news for snow bunnies. And it's all thanks to something called the SAM.

title.children: Why Sydney’s sunny weather is great news for the ski season

image.altText: A group of excited English women cricketers high-five and celebrate as a dejected Australian batter stands in the background.

items.synopsis: England beats Australia for a third successive match, claiming a tense one-day international in Bristol.

title.children: England defeats Australia in tense Women's Ashes one-day international in Bristol

image.altText: A black and white photo of a women being dragged by two police officers

items.synopsis: There has been a recent spate of protesters interrupting sporting events, but disrupting competitive matches to convey a political message is nothing new. Can it really make a difference?

title.children: Can sports and politics mix? Protesters says Australia's anti-apartheid protests changed history

image.altText: A composite image of Hayao Miyazaki holding an Oscar statuette and the poster for New Studio Ghibli film

items.synopsis: Award-winning Japanese animation company Studio Ghibli is less than two weeks away from releasing its latest movie — without any trailers, promotion or even a storyline. Here's what we know.

title.children: Studio Ghibli's new movie is coming out in less than two weeks. They don't want you to know anything about it

image.altText: A middle-aged white woman with short brown hair. She is in front of a suburban football pitch at night, lit by flood lights

items.synopsis: As the FIFA Women's World Cup draws closer, Australians are catching football fever. And outside the elite level, there's an increasingly popular version of the game that's helping people play in a safe and inclusive way.

title.children: Cath had a double lung transplant in 2017, but that hasn't stopped her playing the sport she loves
